com.oracle.tools.deferred
Class Notified<T>

java.lang.Object
  com.oracle.tools.deferred.Notified<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Deferred<T>
public class Notified<T>
extends Object
implements Deferred<T>

A Notified is a Deferred that represents a synchronized object that should be Object.notify()ed, including with Object.notifyAll(), before it can be used.

Important: This implementation assumes that spurious Operating System "wake ups" on a synchronized object during a Object.wait() call are equivalent to a Object.notify() or Object.notifyAll() call on the said object. That is, this implementation does not distinguish between an Operating System spurious wake up of an object or an call to Object.notify() or Object.notifyAll() on an object.

Author:
Brian Oliver

Method Detail

get

public T get()
      throws ObjectNotAvailableException
Attempts to obtain the underlying object.

Specified by:
get in interface Deferred<T>
Returns:
the object of type T or null if it's not ready to be acquired (but may become available at some time in the future)
Throws:
ObjectNotAvailableException - when the Deferred implementation can't produce the requested resource. When this exception is thrown a program may safely assume that the required object will never be become available

getDeferredClass

public Class<T> getDeferredClass()
Obtains the Class of the Deferred reference. ie: the Class that a call to Deferred.get().getClass() should return if/when the Deferred object becomes available.

This method is important as it allows applications to determine an expected type of returned object, even when the actual object may not, or ever become available.

Specified by:
getDeferredClass in interface Deferred<T>
Returns:
the Class of the Deferred object
